post.body:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I *do* know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life.  Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me.
But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.

post.body:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I *do* know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life.  Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me.
But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.

I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me.
But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.body_html:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I do know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life. Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me. But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid.

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late.

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.title: My thoughts on the high functioning autism epidemic

parent.body: Maybe you are just a realist? I've often wondered about the kids that stare into snow globes and never talk, then suddenly one day they are fluent in language. In their minds maybe nobody had anything interesting or pertinent to say. Maybe they just don't care?

parent.body:
I had a glance through but from what I've read you're not wrong at all, now for the record, I think autism is a very real thing internet jokes about it aside what I believe is happening is perhaps a bit paranoid but believe that there has been a mass coverup of both shitty parenting and shitty teaching, but mostly shitty teaching. The boomer generation has created a good couple of generations of children that don't know how to even cook for themselves or do any kind of real maths and they try and cover it up by claiming that their children must have a mental illness. 

The reason I think this is because a lot of it is all down to the community and it's easier to pretend a ton of people mysteriously have some kind of mental health issue than admit that our education standards are so bad that we simply don't teach children the skills they need to be functioning adults. We live in a society as well that pretty much celebrates having a mental illness, I mean just look at all the fucking SJWs etc. who are throwing it up on their profiles like it's a medal and they get rewarded for it. Why put in any work in overcoming anything you're going through when you're surrounded by people like that on a daily basis? 

What my journey has been in regards to this is to go back correcting literally everything that I 'learned' in school and it's amazing how many holes in my education there were, now I'm pissed off. People need to go back to their education instead of just assuming there's something wrong with them because very often the education if it's not the parenting is where it all starts and you might surprise yourself. Back when I was young and did my GSCEs I got an F in maths and now I'm studying programming and writing in C# and Python, the education system is completely full of shit and people need to be aware of that.

TLDR: Identify what could be an actual mental illness issue as opposed to just having a shitty education and then work on fixing both rather than making any assumptions either way.

Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.body_html:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I do know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life. Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me. But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid.

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late.

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.

body:
Sorry for this late response. Had to create a new account because they suspended my old one for joking about doing grafitti 🙄

I think anyone who grew up heavily isolated from other kids, unable to find any hobbies (eg playing the guitar or video games), and was generally just locked up and neglected by his parents would've ended up like me. My childhood was utterly soul crushing. 

There was no obvious abuse in the way most would imagine, but there was literally nothing for me to do at all. My parents were HIGHLY overprotective and sheltered me. They did not have the monry for any hobbies they were accepting of, andgfaming was completely  off limits (the few other boys knew growing up wanted nothing to do with me, as they were always talking about halo which my mother claim ends was satanic). 

I couldn't get into sports because of severe asthma, and besides that, I was always very weak. My parents didn't care much about my nutrition, and they lacked the money for most food anyway.

The neighbors were all girls. We got along fine early on, but as our brains began to develop differently, we went different ways. They were allowed to use phones and they'd  chat about music video while I was told that phones and modern music is satanic. I was told the whole world is satanic and brainwashed against it. I never realized that the only two people in my life (mom and dad) were nutters themselves and so I made the mistake of modelling myself after them, particularly  my mom.

They never gave me much encouragement or support either. When they did, I smelled BS from a mile away knowing how they normallly treated  me.

It's kind of ironic really. My parents kept me out of public school from the start because they said it was like a prison, yet they made my own home into the most miserable prison possible. I had no privacy, no freedom, my parents never let me develop at my own pace or take the reigns one in a while, nothing. I was treated more like a pet than an actual human. I was there merely as entertainment. 

My sister of course got all the love she could imagine. She could do no wrong in my parents eyes. They'd  give her whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted.

My preteen and early teen years weren't much better. I finally got to start playing video games, so I spent my time doing that instead of watching TV. My dad became verbally abusive during this period too. Having your drunk dad look you in the eyes and yell that he wants to genuinely kill you is much more traumatic than you might think.

Anyone would end up like me with a childhood like my own. Not to say that how I've acted is right, but it's for a reason. I'm not retarded. I'm just hurt.

I'm a normal person who grew up at the mercy of two freaks. I don't hold a grudge against them, but I certainly wouldn't  have been their kid if I had a choice.

parent.body: The symptoms you described are still autistic. You can understand social situations and still have a disconnect with the world. This variety is more common in girls but anyone can have it, and the fake personas and such are often included. No typical person would *ever* even consider those choices in my experience, and from your description they seemed more or less natural to you at the time. Normal humans are hardwired social conformists who live in tribes and have a very collectivist nature.

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.body_html:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I do know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life. Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me. But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid.

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late.

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.title: My thoughts on the high functioning autism epidemic

body:
> The neighbors were all girls. We got along fine early on, but as our brains began to develop differently, we went different ways.

Usually puberty affects your emotions and talents but can't change your personality, that's cemented by about age 4. But it usually does seem to change because of a push from parents who want to see their kids grow up exactly as they imagined them when they were born, and puberty *does* make you a lot more conformist and aware of social expectations. 99% of people mask themselves like crazy once they enter adolescence. If anyone doesn't they're either exceptionally determined, or have ASD, because conformity is one of the pillars of human nature, along with selfishness and sex.

> They were allowed to use phones and they'd chat about music video while I was told that phones and modern music is satanic. I was told the whole world is satanic and brainwashed against it. I never realized that the only two people in my life (mom and dad) were nutters themselves and so I made the mistake of modelling myself after them, particularly my mom.

Let me guess, were they IFB or something similar? Ironic, because by my observation those cults which think everything but them is satan are more like satan themselves.

> It's kind of ironic really. My parents kept me out of public school from the start because they said it was like a prison, yet they made my own home into the most miserable prison possible. I had no privacy, no freedom, my parents never let me develop at my own pace or take the reigns one in a while, nothing. I was treated more like a pet than an actual human. I was there merely as entertainment.

Sounds like a case of narcissistic personality disorder. Or if they're involved in the wrong kind of church, those pastors scare them into thinking that's how they're supposed to treat people in the name of "righteousness", which of course entails everything the opposite of the one they claim as their deity. Even worse, up until a generation or two ago this was not only normal but expected, and you were bad if you *didn't* do it. Talk about calling evil good and good evil.

> My sister of course got all the love she could imagine. She could do no wrong in my parents eyes. They'd give her whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted.

Classic case of Women Are Wonderful. I'm not joking, humans are hardwired to naturally care about women but not men. It's because you don't need nearly as many men for the species to survive, so our instincts don't regard them anywhere close to as valuable. It really sucks.

> My preteen and early teen years weren't much better. I finally got to start playing video games, so I spent my time doing that instead of watching TV. My dad became verbally abusive during this period too. Having your drunk dad look you in the eyes and yell that he wants to genuinely kill you is much more traumatic than you might think.

If this is actually true you should've sought CPS services. Unfortunately the abuse was upheld in society for a very long time and is still normalized in extreme fundie cults. In fact I know some genuine people who unfortunately still succumb to this lie, some of them very good and people I'd consider close friends. And when they treat you like that it's the most awful feeling, it makes you feel like you must be the worst person who ever lived to get such nice people to suddenly hate you that much, even when you know they're just acting because they're so brainwashed into thinking they have to treat people like absolute shit to be a proper authority figure. It feels like they want to kill you, and then you want to kill yourself because you look up to them and they're otherwise good people, reinforcing the idea that you must *really* deserve it. It's as if Jesus had acted the way he did for his whole life, and you were one of his disciples, and then you made some kind of mistake and he suddenly decided to never ever forgive you for it. That would never happen with him, but that's how it feels with these people. And unfortunately they are also generally the type to not understand mental disorders and see people with them as just being anti-social or making excuses, leading them to commonly suffer this wrath over things they couldn't even control. And most "Christians" glorify and idolize this as if it's some golden standard of morality. In reality it's simply hardwired human behavior, hoarding power and gripping as much control for yourself as possible, and this was the excuse they made up to get away with it. Which is *totally* nothing like the Pharisees and Sadducees. And the good-hearted people are still usually gullible and pressured to conform, so they mistakenly copied the evil abusers thinking it was their duty. And some people still do that.

> Anyone would end up like me with a childhood like my own. Not to say that how I've acted is right, but it's for a reason. I'm not retarded. I'm just hurt.

That will cause social struggles but not an actual disinterest in society. This is a hardwired instinct and it is not at all normal to not have it.

As you can probably tell I don't like human nature very much. Actually I'd go as far as to say it's inherently satanic.

parent.body:
Sorry for this late response. Had to create a new account because they suspended my old one for joking about doing grafitti 🙄

I think anyone who grew up heavily isolated from other kids, unable to find any hobbies (eg playing the guitar or video games), and was generally just locked up and neglected by his parents would've ended up like me. My childhood was utterly soul crushing. 

There was no obvious abuse in the way most would imagine, but there was literally nothing for me to do at all. My parents were HIGHLY overprotective and sheltered me. They did not have the monry for any hobbies they were accepting of, andgfaming was completely  off limits (the few other boys knew growing up wanted nothing to do with me, as they were always talking about halo which my mother claim ends was satanic). 

I couldn't get into sports because of severe asthma, and besides that, I was always very weak. My parents didn't care much about my nutrition, and they lacked the money for most food anyway.

The neighbors were all girls. We got along fine early on, but as our brains began to develop differently, we went different ways. They were allowed to use phones and they'd  chat about music video while I was told that phones and modern music is satanic. I was told the whole world is satanic and brainwashed against it. I never realized that the only two people in my life (mom and dad) were nutters themselves and so I made the mistake of modelling myself after them, particularly  my mom.

They never gave me much encouragement or support either. When they did, I smelled BS from a mile away knowing how they normallly treated  me.

It's kind of ironic really. My parents kept me out of public school from the start because they said it was like a prison, yet they made my own home into the most miserable prison possible. I had no privacy, no freedom, my parents never let me develop at my own pace or take the reigns one in a while, nothing. I was treated more like a pet than an actual human. I was there merely as entertainment. 

My sister of course got all the love she could imagine. She could do no wrong in my parents eyes. They'd  give her whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted.

My preteen and early teen years weren't much better. I finally got to start playing video games, so I spent my time doing that instead of watching TV. My dad became verbally abusive during this period too. Having your drunk dad look you in the eyes and yell that he wants to genuinely kill you is much more traumatic than you might think.

Anyone would end up like me with a childhood like my own. Not to say that how I've acted is right, but it's for a reason. I'm not retarded. I'm just hurt.

I'm a normal person who grew up at the mercy of two freaks. I don't hold a grudge against them, but I certainly wouldn't  have been their kid if I had a choice.

And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me. But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid.

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late.

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.
post.title: My thoughts on the high functioning autism epidemic

body:
The thing is, it wasn't just a disinterest in society.  It was a hatred of it. It was all out of anger, fear, sheltering, and brainwashing. But I chose it. I knew what I was doing  and did it anyway because I had no joy in life. I've been noticeably unhappy since I was 7 like I said. I feel like I'm at war with the whole world.


That is not ASD. It may be, however, a personality disorder, trauma disorder, depressive  disorder, or anxiety disorder. Possibly a combination of them.


And this is ignoring my untreated ADHD and OCD, derealization issues, and lack of any joy ultimately. When you've been dealing with this since your early childhood and you haven't  gotten help, it builds up.

parent.body:
> The neighbors were all girls. We got along fine early on, but as our brains began to develop differently, we went different ways.

Usually puberty affects your emotions and talents but can't change your personality, that's cemented by about age 4. But it usually does seem to change because of a push from parents who want to see their kids grow up exactly as they imagined them when they were born, and puberty *does* make you a lot more conformist and aware of social expectations. 99% of people mask themselves like crazy once they enter adolescence. If anyone doesn't they're either exceptionally determined, or have ASD, because conformity is one of the pillars of human nature, along with selfishness and sex.

> They were allowed to use phones and they'd chat about music video while I was told that phones and modern music is satanic. I was told the whole world is satanic and brainwashed against it. I never realized that the only two people in my life (mom and dad) were nutters themselves and so I made the mistake of modelling myself after them, particularly my mom.

Let me guess, were they IFB or something similar? Ironic, because by my observation those cults which think everything but them is satan are more like satan themselves.

> It's kind of ironic really. My parents kept me out of public school from the start because they said it was like a prison, yet they made my own home into the most miserable prison possible. I had no privacy, no freedom, my parents never let me develop at my own pace or take the reigns one in a while, nothing. I was treated more like a pet than an actual human. I was there merely as entertainment.

Sounds like a case of narcissistic personality disorder. Or if they're involved in the wrong kind of church, those pastors scare them into thinking that's how they're supposed to treat people in the name of "righteousness", which of course entails everything the opposite of the one they claim as their deity. Even worse, up until a generation or two ago this was not only normal but expected, and you were bad if you *didn't* do it. Talk about calling evil good and good evil.

> My sister of course got all the love she could imagine. She could do no wrong in my parents eyes. They'd give her whatever she wanted, whenever she wanted.

Classic case of Women Are Wonderful. I'm not joking, humans are hardwired to naturally care about women but not men. It's because you don't need nearly as many men for the species to survive, so our instincts don't regard them anywhere close to as valuable. It really sucks.

> My preteen and early teen years weren't much better. I finally got to start playing video games, so I spent my time doing that instead of watching TV. My dad became verbally abusive during this period too. Having your drunk dad look you in the eyes and yell that he wants to genuinely kill you is much more traumatic than you might think.

If this is actually true you should've sought CPS services. Unfortunately the abuse was upheld in society for a very long time and is still normalized in extreme fundie cults. In fact I know some genuine people who unfortunately still succumb to this lie, some of them very good and people I'd consider close friends. And when they treat you like that it's the most awful feeling, it makes you feel like you must be the worst person who ever lived to get such nice people to suddenly hate you that much, even when you know they're just acting because they're so brainwashed into thinking they have to treat people like absolute shit to be a proper authority figure. It feels like they want to kill you, and then you want to kill yourself because you look up to them and they're otherwise good people, reinforcing the idea that you must *really* deserve it. It's as if Jesus had acted the way he did for his whole life, and you were one of his disciples, and then you made some kind of mistake and he suddenly decided to never ever forgive you for it. That would never happen with him, but that's how it feels with these people. And unfortunately they are also generally the type to not understand mental disorders and see people with them as just being anti-social or making excuses, leading them to commonly suffer this wrath over things they couldn't even control. And most "Christians" glorify and idolize this as if it's some golden standard of morality. In reality it's simply hardwired human behavior, hoarding power and gripping as much control for yourself as possible, and this was the excuse they made up to get away with it. Which is *totally* nothing like the Pharisees and Sadducees. And the good-hearted people are still usually gullible and pressured to conform, so they mistakenly copied the evil abusers thinking it was their duty. And some people still do that.

> Anyone would end up like me with a childhood like my own. Not to say that how I've acted is right, but it's for a reason. I'm not retarded. I'm just hurt.

That will cause social struggles but not an actual disinterest in society. This is a hardwired instinct and it is not at all normal to not have it.

As you can probably tell I don't like human nature very much. Actually I'd go as far as to say it's inherently satanic.

post.body:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I *do* know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life.  Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me.
But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.

body:
> The thing is, it wasn't just a disinterest in society. It was a hatred of it. It was all out of anger, fear, sheltering, and brainwashing. But I chose it. I knew what I was doing and did it anyway because I had no joy in life. I've been noticeably unhappy since I was 7 like I said. I feel like I'm at war with the whole world.

You should be. You've seen the truth. I hate to say it, but this is the truth about them.

And btw, the fact that you're able to recognize it at all is a huge sign of ASD.

> That is not ASD. It may be, however, a personality disorder, trauma disorder, depressive disorder, or anxiety disorder. Possibly a combination of them.

Except it is. What else do you think it is? I know you say you "chose" to do this, but no normal person would *choose* to go against society, not naturally anyway. It's against every fiber of human nature.

> And this is ignoring my untreated ADHD and OCD, derealization issues, and lack of any joy ultimately.

In my opinion that's more or less related to being a male and suffering through a puberty that is designed to benefit females at your expense, especially mentally. In nature, your only purpose for existing is to give seed and provide and protect, other than that you're a worthless burden on humanity. And society, as I said, because of human nature doesn't give a SHIT about you, and you're always told to stop whining and tough it out no matter how bad it gets. Oh, and don't forget that it's all your fault!

> When you've been dealing with this since your early childhood and you haven't gotten help, it builds up.

I have all these issues too and it's not because of how anyone treated me. That's legit just what puberty fucking does to your mind. I had problems before then too but they were not a fraction as bad. I got some "help" but it basically only teaches you how to mask everything with the threat of being punished if you fail to do so.

post.body:
Hey Ruqqies. I'm 17 and I'm going through a sort of mini-midlife crisis right now realizing I threw my entire childhood down the shitter, partly because of suppressed shame from an autism (mis)diagnosis. I'm stoned right now so if this is awkward then I'm sorry. I'll probably be deleting this when I wake up tomorrow.

I just wanted to talk about the diagnosis of Asperger's/autism and why I think it's really so commonly diagnosed, and how it's actually making kids worse.

To be clear, I do think Asperger's is a real disorder, but it's actually much rarer than it's made out to be. The problem isn't an increase in autism, but rather an increase in normal, socially awkward kids being misdiagnosed.

Alright, with that out of the way, let's get down to business.

Firstly, I *do* know what I'm doing. I know I'm weird, I could control it, but I simply don't. And I'm too embarrassed to admit it. I've been like this my whole life.  Rather than change, I simply suppressed my negative thoughts for most of my life.

When the Asperger's diagnosis came along in 2011, I was already confused about my emotions and too frightened to admit what was going on. All the sudden, I believed I couldn't improve no matter what, and I think I just gave up. I forgot all my emotions thinking they were a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.

I was homeschooled and extremely sheltered until 2019 when I tried to take the reigns and go to a public high school. There's a big culture shock leaving the small home I was stuck in for this big, complex real world. The fact that this wasn't considered by doctors is pretty surprising, but I probably never told them how I felt in the first place knowing how shy I was.

Since I was 6, I've had no joy in life. Maybe you could call it depression? I would. The world is dull, grey, numb, cold, and indifferent to me from my perspective. Nobody gives a shit about me. That's how I feel. My parents are strange and crazy enough and me, being homeschooled, had no way of realizing that (I actually did, but I think I ended up numbing myself to that early on to protect myself from the pain). My dad has always taught me to see the bad in everything. He's a miserable man.

I have always been extremely passive aggressive. I think I hate my parents, but hid it so deep within my head that it fell into my subconscious for a long time.

I've become so confused about my own emotions that I've lost any shred of personality I may have been able to develop, and have instead become lost in a false persona. I killed my soul, buried it, and built a new one, and I can't find a shovel to dig up the old one.

I think my parents have played a huge role in all this. I still have to keep my false, naive child persona around them rather than truly mature because I cannot live with what how I've acted and how I've made a fool of myself. I did try to change somewhat in 2019, but I just can't embrace normality until I can get away from everyone who knows my past. Imagine this kid (https://youtu.be/IORGuTdpSeo) amped up by about 3 times exactly (I am being literal), and that would be me until 15 and a half. And look at the way his parents act around him (I recently rediscovered my ability to read body language after I forgot it as a preteen after years of doing nothing but using the internet), and even how they talk about him. They clearly hate him, and maybe they themselves are suppressing their hatred for him. He and I are very similar.

Don't think it's all their fault though. I have always chosen vengeance, anger, and fear and the low route in general throughout my entire life. I am motivated completely by self interest because I'm too scared to see the objectifive reality and how much of a loser I really am. I am such a pussy to the point that I'm too afraid to learn from my own mistakes. Humiliation is terrifying to me.
But they did a lot to push me into this position of fearful rage.

My point is, I display many of the autistic symptoms almost by choice for some reason, and I know it's because I made so many terrible choices growing up. I've chosen to be a man child.

Now, considering how typical this is unexplainably with kids today, while also considering how different the social climate is, and the fact that there are no consistent differences in the high functioning autistic brain structure compared to a normal one, I find it hard to believe this is a true neurological disorder. Instead, I believe Asperger's/High functioning autism is a new phenomenon (Strange how that behavior was so rare in the Past compared to now) caused by a generation of awkward millennial (gen y and z) children having difficulties adapting to the new mid 21st century culture while battling memories of the less cynical late 20th/early 21st century. They are so afraid and distant that they don't even want to understand why they're afraid. 

There is no high functioning autism. Just unattractive (we do tend to be ugly) children with severe anxiety and a tendency towards extreme passive aggressiveness as well as roleplaying.

Rather than face these issues, the confused children are told it's out of their control and hopelessy choose to withdraw into a fantasy world.

For lower functioning cases, I don't have as much of a problem (there are noticeable differences in brain structure). As for high functioning autism, I think we're setting a generation up for a world of hurt.

We're not retards (no offense to the lower functioning). We're twisted and confused in our own goals and unwilling to change out of fear.

I'm so distant and separate from everyone in life that I'm not entirely in reality.

The last lines of Black Sabbath's song, "paranoid," really resonate with me. "And so as you hear these words telling you now of my state, I tell you to enjoy life I wish I could but it's too late."

It feels too late. 

But as an adult, I will be able to have a second chance. It's not over yet. I have another 10 years that have the potential to be infinitely better than the last.

Autism, at least in my case, is caused by a bad mindset I've adapted over the years. And I think that's the way it is for most people "on the spectrum" at this point.

Edit: Alright, I'm not gonna take this down. Thank you all for your support. It means a lot to me.

parent.body:
> The thing is, it wasn't just a disinterest in society. It was a hatred of it. It was all out of anger, fear, sheltering, and brainwashing. But I chose it. I knew what I was doing and did it anyway because I had no joy in life. I've been noticeably unhappy since I was 7 like I said. I feel like I'm at war with the whole world.

You should be. You've seen the truth. I hate to say it, but this is the truth about them.

And btw, the fact that you're able to recognize it at all is a huge sign of ASD.

> That is not ASD. It may be, however, a personality disorder, trauma disorder, depressive disorder, or anxiety disorder. Possibly a combination of them.

Except it is. What else do you think it is? I know you say you "chose" to do this, but no normal person would *choose* to go against society, not naturally anyway. It's against every fiber of human nature.

> And this is ignoring my untreated ADHD and OCD, derealization issues, and lack of any joy ultimately.

In my opinion that's more or less related to being a male and suffering through a puberty that is designed to benefit females at your expense, especially mentally. In nature, your only purpose for existing is to give seed and provide and protect, other than that you're a worthless burden on humanity. And society, as I said, because of human nature doesn't give a SHIT about you, and you're always told to stop whining and tough it out no matter how bad it gets. Oh, and don't forget that it's all your fault!

> When you've been dealing with this since your early childhood and you haven't gotten help, it builds up.

I have all these issues too and it's not because of how anyone treated me. That's legit just what puberty fucking does to your mind. I had problems before then too but they were not a fraction as bad. I got some "help" but it basically only teaches you how to mask everything with the threat of being punished if you fail to do so.
